titleStmt.title: The five faithful brothers., or, A dialogue being a true discourse between His Majesty Charles the Second, and the five brothers at his escape from Worcester together with the severall discourses and passages that past betwixt them. With Mris Lanes conveying of His Majesty through all his difficulties; and his obscurity in the oake for many daies. And his taking shipping in Sussex. This being related by the five brothers and taken from their own mouths.
titleStmt.author: H. T.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: British Library.
